title: Bug 28974: Compiler error when introducing a 'final' field
description: When introducing a 'final' field, a compilation error occurs with no source information available. To resolve this, follow the steps to enable or disable the creation of type comments in WindowPreferencesJavaCode Generation.
OB: When attempting to compile the provided aspect with version 1.1b2, it results in a compilation error. The specific error message is as follows: 'Cannot assign a value to the final field com.ibm.amc.DemoBean.ajc$interField$comibmamc$verbose!!'
EB: The expected behavior is that the aspect should compile successfully without any errors. To achieve this, users can enable or disable the creation of type comments in WindowPreferencesJavaCode Generation.
SR:
1. Open the WindowPreferences dialog.
2. Navigate to Java Code Generation settings.
3. Enable or disable the creation of type comments as needed.
